newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia sees 1998 foreign borrowing/aid at $9.6 bln.
newsitem.headline: Russia sees 1998 foreign borrowing/aid at $9.6 bln.

text.p: Russia plans to attract $9.6 billion from foreign markets and international lending agencies in 1998, including $3 billion from Eurobonds, official government forecasts issued on Thursday said.

The forecasts, distributed at a government meeting on economic development during the first half of 1997, also said Russia planned in 1998 to raise 97.4 trillion roubles from all domestic sources to finance the budget deficit, up from 96.5 trillion in 1997.
